website_summaries.verdict: These washable training pants are cute and comfortable. They're perfect for little girls or boys (both styles available) who have almost graduated from diapers but still need a little protection.
pros: Parents praise these training pants for their absorbency without being too thick or bulky
Cotton material is soft and comfortable on delicate skin, and it's also flexible with youngsters' movements
Holds up well to repeated washings
cons: Not waterproof, so not the best pick for little ones who are in the early phases of potty training
Leg holes may fit a bit snug on kids with chubby legs

customer_reviews.title: Choose the Boys' Pack Over Girls' - Better Padding and Size
customer_reviews.text: I bought the boys' sports training pants and those fit perfectly and have great padding, so when I needed more I decided to get some girlier ones. The girls' version came in and not only are they much bigger, but the padding isn't as good. If you're someone who doesn't care if your girl has little sports balls on her training pants, I recommend getting the boy version.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Works for a tiny toosh
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't actually looking for training pants but these are the smallest undies I could find for my 20lb 2 year old who is potty training. Pull ups did not work for either of my daughters, felt like a diaper to them. These training pants are great. Just enough padding to absorb enough of the pee so you don't have a huge mess to clean up. Don't expect them to absorb a bladder full though. 18mo size fit my daughter well with a little wiggle room.
customer_reviews.author: Bethanne

customer_reviews.title: Fits Slender 18 Month Olds!
customer_reviews.text: We looked all over the stores for 18 month old underwear for our twins that were potty trained at 18 months, no luck as they start at 2 yr olds. So thankful we found these Gerber training pants! These fit great on our 18 month olds fitting into 18 month old clothes. These do not hold a lot of urine but do held protect against major accidents that might happen... There is a thicker liner on the bottom of each pair that help keep little ones drier but to let them know they have gone. These are not as thin as regular toddler underwear.
customer_reviews.author: Japan Expert

customer_reviews.title: Thick underwear
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this did exactly what it should. No it doesn’t hold all the pee in but it holds enough so there isn’t a lake on your floor. Easy to clean and fit well on my 2 year old. She wears the 2T and is about 25 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers who are potty-trained
customer_reviews.text: These fit great on my 2 year old who is potty training and this makes her feel slightly wet, but somehow she's fine with the wetness most days. I guess it's absorbent enough and it doesn't bother her. I didn't want to deal with leaky messes and these pants are wonderful because I never have to deal with leaky messes, but I need her to be somewhat uncomfortable so she learns to go to potty. I think these are great for kids who are already potty-trained, but have occasional accidents.
customer_reviews.author: kayni

customer_reviews.title: I love these. Its a great transition from pampers to ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Its a great transition from pampers to underwear because its tall and gives a similar fit to a pamper. (My daughter didnt like the regular underwears at first because they felt weird) Also its padded so it doesnt create such a big mess when they have an accident vs a regular underwear (once its not a really big one)
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: Best underwear for potty training/newly potty trained littles! So much easier to pull these up and down than the thin cotton ones. The thicker absorbent core is helpful to soak some of the mess of accidents, and when accidents are no longer an issue, it still gives me a bit more peace of mind knowing she has slight protection if needed. We call them her soft & cozy undies. Also, I found sizing was just right. I was torn between 2T and 3T, I got the 3T and it's slightly loose/baggy but not enough to fall down, they are comfortable for her, glad I went with the bigger size. One complaint is I wish they would make them tagless!
customer_reviews.author: Joymama12

customer_reviews.title: Great option for Potty Training during the day
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, these are the best underwear to use when potty training a young child. :-) I have 3 kids and this is the best quality and thickness (but not bulky) for day use. They absorb well for being underwear. They allow the child to feel the wetness but keep enough in so it doesn't run down their leg. They do get the pants/bottoms wet also, but not as much as a thin pair of regular underwear. When we travel I do put a Pull Up over these for extra protection. Definitely recommend for potty training/early trained children.
customer_reviews.author: nyteachnc

customer_reviews.title: Great for small accidents when potty training
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my daughter. It has light padding for small accidents, but won't catch a full pee. They fit her perfectly, but will shrink if put into the dryer so we air dry them. (Found out when a pair snuck into the dryer one time...)
customer_reviews.author: NT

customer_reviews.title: Slim Waisted Toddler still fits in 18 month
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and a pack of Lamaze training pants in size 18 months at the same time. The Gerber's work well for their purpose, but the Lamaze are a little more forgiving for accidents, softer to the touch, and slightly bigger in the waist. I like the Gerber's well enough for their purpose, but I wouldn’t expect too much of them for holding liquids. They are not diapers, they are much closer to standard underwear, and really aren’t meant to absorb much. But they are handy for potty training toddlers with tiny waists as long as you understand the training pants purpose and have realistic expectations for these slightly thicker underwear.
customer_reviews.author: E. Slengel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing panties during potty training
customer_reviews.text: Amazing panties during potty training. With other regular panties, sometimes it leaked all the way down to the shoes. However with these Gerber panties, that never happened!! Totally love it.
customer_reviews.author: JYNY

customer_reviews.title: Great for outings in first months of potty training
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 18m they are not too tight on the legs (problem I found with other brands) so they quite comfortable and easier for her to pull up for her than other brands. Great for outings and day care so even if she has a pre-pee she can make it to toilet without showing she had a small accident and only needs a change of underwear rather than all clothing. One but is a quality as some threads started to let go after few washings but only in one place so it was easy to fix. Still would rather use those die to comfort and ease of use rather than top quality overpriced and uncomfortable ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ag

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Although inconsistent, my 22 month old has been going in the potty for several months now. Decided to buy these as a nudge to get her to start going consistently. She's on the small end but the 18 month size fit her perfectly, with a bit of room to grow. She's 22 months and almost 23lbs. These are also super soft and have just enough padding to hold a dribble or so. Plus they just look so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy regular underwear..they work the same!
customer_reviews.text: These are a joke for potty training pants!! They look cute and they fit great but the have literally no purpose. The padding is so thin that every time my daughter has an accident they leak all over. They literally hold only poop and nothing else. I thought these were like a different pair I bought off amazon and they aren't at all. Don't waste your money on these! They are the equivalent to regular underwear!
customer_reviews.author: popester4547

customer_reviews.title: Fits my petite LO
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is very petite - she's 2.5 years old and weighs 23lbs. I was scared that I wouldn't find training pants that fit her. These are perfect and comfortable. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andaye Y. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your $ might as well go naked!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help my daughter potty train my granddaughter. I used Gerber when she was a toddler now 32. I'm sadly dissapointed in these now! May as well just have her go naked. The pee literally not only soaks thru but becomes a stream rolling down her leg. It's as if she has NOTHING on at all. A complete waste of time n money!!! So disappointed in Gerber!!!
customer_reviews.author: L Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Fits well even after many washes and is comfortable. I bought for my 2
customer_reviews.text: Fits well even after many washes and is comfortable. I bought for my 2.5 year old who was still in 18mo clothing. If she leaks a little, no big deal. It helps her make it to the potty in time without me needing to change her clothes or wipe messes off the floor. This is not absorbent like a cloth diaper nor does it have pul to prevent urine from getting on clothes, But it is a lot better than single cotton cloth kid underwear out there. These are my go to all the time, but especially going out anywhere when we need more than 30 sec. to get to a bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for potty training days!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality training undies, they are really soft and the extra padded area in between the legs is just thick enough to hold a small pee pee or poo poo accident. They fit a little higher than most girl's undies, around the waist, but that's not an issue for us, I actually like the fact that they are not hip undies. I love this undies for my twins, they are helping a lot during our potty training process. They shrink a little bit after washing them, so make sure you order one size up. My girls are 25lb @ 14 months, I ordered size 18month but had to exchange for size 2t.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy to Twins

customer_reviews.title: Glitter Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize they had glitter. I do not want to send that stuff out into the water steam. Please don't use glitter anymore Gerber. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Cotton, absorbent, but stretch out at ~10 months
customer_reviews.text: 2019 April 22 Originally were meeting our needs (orig 5 stars), for our skinny and long 2 year old. A bit big on a 25 lb, but did not have an issue on them falling down until month 10, when these super-absorbing (for any minor leaks), and soft-to-the-touch cotton training pants began to stretch beyond use :-( Very disappointed, as they are in very good condition otherwise, but one by one (we had originally bought 2 packages) are being set aside hoping to find time to cinch them up.
customer_reviews.author: David Jackemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Cute training pants
customer_reviews.text: Love these training pants. They are absorbing and help keep the mess to a minimum. Cute patterns, soft, and fit well. I’ve used Gerber trainer for both kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Little girls like these. The colors are fun and appealing. They fit just as they are supposed to. These are also good quality, not like some others that tear in a month. They’re made of a nice, thick material. Have had these for two years, and they’re still good. They are also soft and comfortable, so little girls won’t complain. She loves these and enjoys wearing them. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginner training and no elastic on leg holes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the great reviews and the price but they are just not up to par. First off, the leg holes are small with no elastic so my daughter, who has average sized legs for a 12 month old, could hardly get into them. Secondly, after only 5 minutes of wearing these she peed right though them, and I don't mean a full pee, but still, her father and her both had to go straight to the shower. I'm returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Charyn Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Runs small in legs; good quality though
customer_reviews.text: Although these have worked for us in the past, this size and fit did not. We ordered the 18 month for our daughter and the leg holes were very snug. The fit would have been perfect, but there was not enough give in the legs to allow for comfort and proper fit. Our daughter is more on the slimmer side, and I was surprised they were so tight. These are great for training! I love the padded material. Very soft and comfy. Holds up in the wash. But this size was simply too small.
customer_reviews.author: MwMoore

customer_reviews.title: She is much more comfortable in them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter who is 3 years and 6 months old. She is still fond of diapers and fights potty training, so we decided to up the game with these training pants. She is much more comfortable in them. I guess they feel close to diapers because of the padded design. She is still learning to hold it and there are accidents, so I am happy to report that these pants do add some protection. The set I bought is pink solid and pink polka dot. She loves the colors. My daughter is tall, and size 3 fits her very well. If your kid is on a petit side, I would recommend to downsize.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie P.

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: These are cute. They don't completely contain accidents but they minimize them because of the extra padding. I'm glad they don't contain completely because when my daughter has pee running down her leg it makes her want to run to the toilet because she's uncomfortable. That's pretty much what you want to make them go on their own. Only issue is the leg holes are too snug on her thighs but fine in the waist, butt, and crotch area.
customer_reviews.author: C.F.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and pricing
customer_reviews.text: Best thing you can ever buy for a baby these work like the ones I used many years ago with my own children this was a gift for my grandchild would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: cheryl ann seitzer

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad purchase for babies ready to switch
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pack of training pants as our 18 month old was showing keen interest in using her potty. I tried to use them in place of diapers, but I found they didnt really discourage her from urinating and as a bonus they aren't super absorbent at all. Running around completely bottomless seems to be more encouraging for her to sit herself down on her potty. When it rains, it pours as they say. I'm not sure they are any more effective at fluid containment than normal undies. That being said, they are very soft and my girl is quite fond of them. Perhaps when she gets a little older they will be of more use to us.
customer_reviews.author: Megan AndersenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for Marathon potty training
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 kids. I have bought all kinds of underwear and training pants through the past 16 years. These are my favorite. The colors are cute and the extra padding is perfect. My daughter did not want to get her "pretty pink panties" dirty. They are very well made and have held up great after being washed more times than I can count. My daughter is very stubborn. They do not crinkle and make noise when she moves or walks like some other training pants. I would definitely recommend these to anyone trying to potty train a stubborn child.
customer_reviews.author: MedicMac

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected, but otherwise good
customer_reviews.text: These were a bit bigger than I expected them to be, based on the size I ordered and the size my daughter wears. But they were so big that we couldn’t use them. I like that they give the option of an underwear like feel with a little bit more absorption. My daughter is mostly potty trained, but occasionally will still have an accident, and these make cleanup easier without taking away from the potty training experience of not wearing a diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This seems to work great: ) They fit try to age/size
customer_reviews.text: During the potty training times I tell myself....as soon as my daughter pees through all 4 pairs then we're done for the day and we'll try again tomorrow. This seems to work great :) They fit try to age/size. I bought the 18 months for her and they fit great...with a tad room to spare. She wears 24 month clothes, but the 18 month undies are better sized for her. Thick middle, but will *not* stop the pee from leaking down their legs and onto the floor...
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for training
customer_reviews.text: These training undies are cute and they are the perfect amount of absorbancy for training. I bought the 18 month size, based on the weight recommendations, even though when we started our daughter was 22 months. She was on the bottom end of the weight recommendations for these and as expected they're a little roomy but they stay up fine and are a comfortable fit. We've been using them for two months and they wash up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great first underwear for potty trainers!
customer_reviews.text: Great underwear for potty training. Fits well around the legs and waist. The leg and waist bands are flexible and soft. They never leave red marks! Ditch the diapers and pull-ups. These underwear absorb enough of the mess so you don't have a ton to clean when accidents happen, but they also allow the tot to feel discomfort so they learn faster. These were the single potty training savers for us!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: They are good quality, hold up through many washes (with some ...
customer_reviews.text: I'e used these with my oldest and now ordered them for my youngest. They are good quality, hold up through many washes (with some rubbing) and are very pleasant to the touch. They are quite absorbent. I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorLana

customer_reviews.title: One of the few 18-month size training pants on the market
customer_reviews.text: We keep buying these underwear because it's so hard to find training pants to fit my small 2-year old and so few companies make training pants in size 18 months (and none smaller from what I've found). They're still a bit big on the little kid, though. They're just starting to not be baggy. They've held up well after a lot of washes and we'll keep using them until she grows out of them (which is unlikely since they're still big).
customer_reviews.author: Nikki K.

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 2 year old granddaughter. They are great. They absorb most of the urine, making accidents not as much to clean up. They are not meant to be totally waterproof, because you want the child to experience what it feels like to be wet. Diapers and pull-ups are what you want if you need to be waterproof. These are like the traditional training pants that have been around forever.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to disposable training pants
customer_reviews.text: These Gerber training pants are a great product for use during potty training, when your toddler isn't quite ready for totally-unabsorbent underwear, but doesn't like the feel of bulky diapers anymore. They're soft and cottony like real underwear, but have a bit of absorbent material between the legs in case of an accident. While they may not be able to absorb a full bladder's worth of urine, I've found that they contain the mess quite a bit better than regular underwear, at a fraction of the cost of Pull Ups or other disposable training pants.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Extra padding and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the few training underwear that are nicely padded for extra absorption for accidents. However, when opening these from the package they had an AWFUL chemical smell! I couldn’t even let them sit on the counter until I washed them my whole room smelled! With a wash they were fine, but still the smell was awful and I can’t help but wonder what from.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Bradu

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: My baby is potty training and two and these are HORRIBLE! THE SIZE 18 MONTHS FITS ME NOT THE BABY IM TRYING TO GET TRAINED! ISNT THERE ENOUGH CRAP WE ALREADY HAVE TO INVEST IN JUST TO HAVE A BABY. CANT WE HAVE TRAINING PANTS TO FIT A 10 POUND TWO YEAR OLD. NO BRAIN CELLS WITH THIS CRAP!
customer_reviews.author: shawnda jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and thick at the bottom. Perfect for potty training! Would definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs one size bigger than expected but still a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in a 2T, and it was shipped fast. I could not find these at the local stores in my town so I was pleasantly surprised that amazon had it. These run one size bigger than expected so buyer beware. I still have a long way to go with potty training my toddler so I don't mind that it is a little big because she can grow into them as she gets older. They have a nice thick padding in the crotch area, which is just what I was looking for in training underpants! The colors are very pretty and vivid and all of it is stitched up quite nicely. Quality craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: PanicAttax

customer_reviews.title: Best undies for potty training though preschool!
customer_reviews.text: This are my favorite undies for my daughter. She's tiny and they show through her leggings sometimes, and it looks like she has mens boxer briefs on. Lol. It's cute though. They cover her! The crotch is about 2 to 3 times as wide as regular briefs for little girls, so when she's sitting "unladylike" you can't see anything. Very soft and comfy. The thick double layer is absorbant if she has an accident. Which helps keep puddles and bed wetting messes very small!
customer_reviews.author: ChelleBelle

customer_reviews.title: love, love
customer_reviews.text: love, love, love these training pants! they are thick enough to catch a little dribble...but by no means is this going to catch a full release. during our 2-week training...these worked great. our daughter had a few accidents...but I definitely prefer these over the thinner briefs. daughter doesn't wipe well (who does at this age?!) - so the thickness of the briefs will absorb it and not show on her pants. her other briefs are so thin that that the wetness penetrated through her navy pants...a little embarrassing. these pants are soft and doesn't cut at the abdomen like some of the other thinner briefs.
customer_reviews.author: JGL

customer_reviews.title: Potty training must!
customer_reviews.text: These are super cute and soft, I like that they don’t have the tight edges around the legs that most little girl underwear do. They have the extra padding to soak up pee. My daughter wet her self yesterday on my bed, she told me soon enough and the underwear asorbed most of it and my bed never got wet. It saved me a wash and that was life changing.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Murray

customer_reviews.title: Just get one set
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and cute patterned, but I wouldn't get too many training pants because if your kid's like mine, she'll either wet through the whole thing regardless of the tiny amount of padding, or it'll just be bulky and annoying. So they were good at the beginning for when she would have accidents because she wasn't paying attention, but now they're just happening when she's sleeping so it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Jade

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: These training undies are so cute! They are very durable. We got them not to use as training undies though. We got them to help clear up really bad diaper rash by soaking them in a medicated solution. They did what we needed them to.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Pefert for potty training!
customer_reviews.text: Looking to potty training without pullups but want less mess... these are what you are looking for!! Cloth undies that are extra think to stop the puddle when your little one has an accident. Soft and fit just like undies, these are just thinker material. Your kids pants will still be soaked if there is an accident, but no puddle for them to step in or splash. And since it is 100% cloth, they learn faster than with those that wick away they moisture. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia V.

customer_reviews.title: I used this same brand with my son when he was potty training and they have not disappointed either time
customer_reviews.text: They fit my 1 1/2 year old daughter perfectly. I used this same brand with my son when he was potty training and they have not disappointed either time. These underwear can hold a good amount of liquid and are perfect for children like my daughter who start to pee but can hold it and get to the toilet to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Cate OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for potty-learning toddler
customer_reviews.text: We needed to start our daughter on some big girl underwear and these were the right price. They have some thickness in the middle to absorb a little accident but wouldn't stop everything, fortunately we haven't had any big accidents. Perfect for potty learning and colors are great too.
customer_reviews.author: Justin L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for potty training
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my granddaughter for potty training. They were easy for her to pull on and off and she liked wearing them. They are thicker than normal panties so they catch any little mistakes but of course they're not water proof.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M

customer_reviews.title: Great for Transitioning During Potty Training, But Run a Bit Large
customer_reviews.text: These were very helpful in transitioning my daughter from "Pull-Ups" to underwear. I was a little nervous about putting my daughter in regular underpants, but I knew that it was time to get her out of Pull-Ups. These were a good compromise. They have a little bit of extra padding that can absorb a little accident. They are soft, durable and absorbent. My only complaint is that they run big. My daughter is thin, but these run at least a size too big.
customer_reviews.author: mhanley

customer_reviews.title: Really really like these training pants
customer_reviews.text: Really really like these training pants. They are so soft. My daughter loves wearing them. I really didn't want anything that had plastic lining in them. As other reviews stated, it won't prevent a leak but it will help prevent a huge mess. I got the 18 month size. My daughter is 23 lbs and is 20 months old. She tends to run on the petite side but usually fits 18mo size clothes. So I feel like they run a little big. I'm glad they run large instead of small though. At least she has some growing room. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Bird

customer_reviews.title: Good panties except leg openings way too small
customer_reviews.text: Everything fit as expected EXCEPT the leg openings. My granddaughter is a tiny girl and those leg openings cut into her thighs. I had to take the scissors to them and split the seam to make them wearable. However, the panties felt comfy and thick and nice.
customer_reviews.author: RubyCat

customer_reviews.title: My twins love them.
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old toddlers are not potty trained yet but hopefully soon. I use these for diaper free time before a bath or when they get a diaper rash due to acidic poop. Life of a parent.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good but runs small
customer_reviews.text: I like these for potty training as they are thicker than normal thin cotton panties and she learns that she’s wet much easier. I wish they came in more designs/characters/colors. I would highly recommend these to anyone although be aware they run small so order a size up if you have a larger child. My toddler is quite small for her age so these are great.
customer_reviews.author: JennyCup

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfy
customer_reviews.text: My lil one was very comfortable with them on. They are well absorbent when she did have an accident not much went through, it was enough for her to realize she had an accident but not so much that a big mess had to be cleaned up. I would for sure recommend and buy more
customer_reviews.author: Angelie1216

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves these. We are potty training and she seems to love walking around on these. Now for the real test - as much as I love these they don't hold much. Accidents are still being transferred through to carpets or anywhere she is sitting. I score this product high because I realize unless she's back in a diaper nothing is going to hold in that amount of urine.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Anaya

customer_reviews.title: NOT 100% Cotton
customer_reviews.text: This item is listed as being cotton. While the outer fabric is cotton, the inner lining is 30% cotton, 70% polyester. This is NOT absorbent or helpful for the potty-training toddler (or the parents). Had I known that the inner padding was not 100% cotton, I would not have purchased this item.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clazel

customer_reviews.title: Extremely large
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these for my 25 mth old and she cannot wear them at all. Even with diapers these are just too large. I wanted to love these but because she just cannot fit into them I cannot even test them out now or anytime soon
customer_reviews.author: Sheenab

customer_reviews.title: Works for toddler
customer_reviews.text: They are well padded, but does not stop accidents from leaking through. They are cute though for just starting out on potty training.
customer_reviews.author: CRWILSON4366

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Training Pants
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 2 year old granddaughter, and she loves them. She weighs about 24 pounds, and she fits better in the 18 month size, but I bought 2T also, and she can wear them. She is petite, so I needed her leg holes to fit snug enough with irritating her, and they do the job. They wash really well, too, and are so soft. She has only had a couple of accidents, but they absorbed it pretty well. I would definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Arlotta

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Fits well. Fabric has a good feel. Very soft. Training underwear did not work for us, though. The padding gave my toddler the false impression of wearing a diaper. Real undies worked out 100% better.
customer_reviews.author: Bruna

customer_reviews.title: These are maybe like wearing 2 pairs of underwear at the same time
customer_reviews.text: They fit as expected, but beware that the padding is not as thick as you may think. It will not really lessen an accident. The way older version of these used to be a lot thicker. These are maybe like wearing 2 pairs of underwear at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: K Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Thigh holes to small in comparison
customer_reviews.text: Great material but the thigh holes are way to small!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Soft and absorbent. I received 4 pair of pink training pants. When I put the item in my cart, the product showed “boys” but I did indeed receive Girls pink underwear’s.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: these are great..
customer_reviews.text: these are great.... you need lots so I got these and the gerber white and the gerber 4pack.... you need to keep changing or you will have a mess...they are not diapers... as soon as they go... you take them to the potty...even if too late... and just get the idea... they allow they child to feel the wetness..and get the idea associated the go to the potty..
customer_reviews.author: Joan D. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My two year old loves them just as expected, very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: chloe

customer_reviews.title: VERY SOFT
customer_reviews.text: Highly satisfied with these training pants! They are very soft, colors are great and they look very cute! They perfectly fit my 10month baby. I use them in the morning to let my baby's bum to "breathe" a little after a diaper. Sometimes she wears them during daytime as well between naps. Will definitely purchase them again
customer_reviews.author: Bakus D

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent and soft
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these for my 2 year old and she loved them. They are super absorbent and soft. They are rather thick but they work for potty training. My daughter felt like a “big” girl.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: 5 year old and love how soft they are
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 3.5 year old and love how soft they are. She is very thin though so these are a little too big for her to wear yet but that's ok because she will grow into them. I also like that the plastic inside is completely covered by the fabric, but it does have the annoying crinkly sound of plastic. I have other training pants that don't make that sound and I like that better, but these are still nice and soft.
customer_reviews.author: MariaC

customer_reviews.title: good in relation to other current options
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer the Lamaze training pants, but they are out of stock (perhaps not being made anymore?) - these are notably less well made with thinner material for a higher price - but are the next best thing if Lamaze is not available
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than regular undies for potty training
customer_reviews.text: I really love these. They are kinda big on my 2 yr old, she weighs 27lbs and it tall and fairly thin. They slip a little but she picks them back up and they don't fall off so we are content (why i gave 4 stars). They don't hold more than a couple tsps of pee but hold in the poop accidents (which, to be frank, deserves an applause). I would recommend these for potty training more than regular undies. She is definitely more comfortable in them than those wedgy prone ones. Happy customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Nice and thick to start potty training. Fits my 2 year old nicely. She is only 21lbs so I purchased the 18 month size which is equal to 2t on other similar underwear according to weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: I know these are to help with potty training and ...
customer_reviews.text: I know these are to help with potty training and leaks are expected I just wish they were a little more absorbent, but at home we wear these without any other pants and they do catch some of the pee.. But not all of it. I didn't think they would anyway, but it has helped my little one use the potty more and more.. she hates having accidents in these. And she loves the "dots" So I guess all in all the pros outweigh the cons.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with size, and very cute.
customer_reviews.text: I got the 18 mo size for my lean 23 mo. They fit great! These are the only ones that fit her! I’m very happy! I ordered some more.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Audra

customer_reviews.title: Almost stops messes, but not quite! Quality crafted!
customer_reviews.text: They fit a little large. Nice quality stitching thick fabric. Does a little to curb a potty trainer from peeing on the couch, but could use more bulk. Definitely does not stop from leak through. Just like a sewn cloth diaper. Thought they were going to be like cloth diapers, but with possible leak through protection for brand new potty training. I did not read much of the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Old school potty training
customer_reviews.text: After doing pull-ups and fancy stuff with my son we decided to go old school with my daughter. My pediatrician said the pull ups are great but really they don't allow the kids to FEEL the wet, so they don't know. These don't stop a full on flood, or a go to potty. There will be clean up. But it does let them know they are wet. And my daughter (who isn't quite ready yet) loves them and will generally take them off to go pee )on the floor half the time) But she doesn't want to go on her cupcake panties. lol. So its a work in progress but i recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Quality Construction, Runs Small
customer_reviews.text: My child is tall and thin for her age but generally wears her age in size. I found these to be a little on the small side. I'm not sure how many hot washes we will make it through before they are officially too small. I do like the quality of the underwear, especially for the price, and I appreciate solid colors and polka dots as opposed to licensed characters.
customer_reviews.author: mamp08Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Very pretty colors. I purchased these for my 16 month old. Her granny bought her some for her first birthday but it was only 3 pair. I don't know where she purchased hers from but every store I went to did not have her size. I was dedicating myself to her training and wanted to eliminate pull-ups since they are not much different then diapers. She weighs 25 pounds and these were perfect. She even seemed excited about them. Great to have four extra pair to add to the three she already have.
customer_reviews.author: Santana

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Great for potty training. Better than the regular big girl panties because they catch a good amount of the urine if there is an accident. I bought a size up even though my girl is only 2 because I don’t like her clothes too tight on her skin. The 2T fits but a little too perfect for my taste.
customer_reviews.author: Howell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for potty training
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness I LOVE these underwear. I put my daughter in them at 15 months and she immediately started potty training. She was able to tell me when she went to the bathroom because she could feel it wet, but we seldom got too much on the floor because the underwear are so absorbent. I first bought two sets of 4, but quickly realized that with her accidents I would need more so I ordered another 8. These are really excellent and I don't think I will go back to diapers or pull-ups while I am potty training. The quality is great, the pattern is cute, and my daughter much prefers them to diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good transition from pull-ups
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my potty training toddler to use at preschool (no pull-ups allowed). They are thicker and catch more than a regular undie would. They fit great!
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Just buy regular underwear
customer_reviews.text: Against the advice of the potty training book we read, I bought these, along with pull ups just in case the method didn't work. These are quite useless. They are underwear with a thicker middle. When my daughter developed vulvovaginitis, we stopped using these for fear the thicker middle area was causing the area to be not as breathable as regular underwear
customer_reviews.author: claudia y.

customer_reviews.title: Great little training pants
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter LOVES polka dots!! These training pants are great!
customer_reviews.author: Shirneen

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a year and 8 months and they fit her perfectly. They so soft and plush. Very absorbent.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Ascencio Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: SIZE UP but also good quality!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wear 2T pull ups and these were tight on her.. they fit maybe for like a month but after a couple washes that was it. They are super cute, great quality and fabric and absorbs REALLY good with an accident.. but just size up!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for start potty training
customer_reviews.text: These little panties are very soft and absorbent well. I'm very please with its capacity to contain the poops, not leaking at all. Since BM is the longer process for potty training it's a necessity. I wish I had bought more but two packs per order could get us through now. It's on the big side and quite stretchable so my 33 months old can wear 18 months size. It's easy to wash, just rinse out the accidents in sink and dry it out. We can rotate the four pairs with ease in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Eva W.Brodbeck

customer_reviews.title: Made potty learning so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: These have made potty training so much easier. I first tried regular girls briefs--the kind that come 7 in a pack from Target with Disney characters. Those leaked after accidents and made potty training harder and more stressful for all of us. These look and feel like "big girl underwear," but they are extremely absorbent so accidents do not leak. Worth the price for sure! I ended up buying more packs.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm!

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much we bought another set
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is almost 3, 32 pounds and we bought the size 3t. They fit perfectly. Cute patterns and works perfectly. Loved it so much we bought another set, and honestly I'll probably buy our 3rd set this week. I love that it's lightly padded to help with those accidents.
customer_reviews.author: Butterflykisses8i8

customer_reviews.title: We love these training panties
customer_reviews.text: We love these training panties. No, they don't soak up everything if your toddler decides to just go in them, but compared to regular panties with no padding they absorb quite a bit! They're especially great if your toddler is in the stage where they might start to pee, then feel it and stop themselves to run to the potty. We still had to change to a fresh pair often throughout the day, but it catches enough that it's usually all I had to do. And when you're potty training, the last thing you want is MORE to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Great undies !!!
customer_reviews.text: These undies are great!! A lifesaver when u are potty training a stubborn toddler, they keep a lot of the pee in the pad so u just have to clean a little bit on the floor sometimes even nothing, they really work.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kral

customer_reviews.title: Didn't send the right items.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product. I ordered size 18 month and they sent two 18 month and two 2t. That was very dissapointing. The elastic around the legs wasn't stretchy and the pads in the training underwear were not thick.
customer_reviews.author: Maritza Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived well packaged, in perfect condition and as expected. I machine wash these and dry them on high heat for a long time to get them completely dry. They have held up very well. No complaints at all. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... for when our daughter is sleeping and they are great. I don't believe they would hold much but ...
customer_reviews.text: We use these instead of pull ups for when our daughter is sleeping and they are great. I don't believe they would hold much but are perfect when you have a toddler who does not typically have accidents at night but you still want a little protection just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle R

customer_reviews.title: OK, but width runs big and leg holes are small
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old daughter is in 24 month clothes. These 18 month training panties are very wide in the bottom, but the leg holes are fairly tight. The fit is a little strange. However, she loves them. They are not absorbent like a pull-up, but that's the whole point. These training pants are just like thick panties. If you're looking for training pants to help your little one potty train, these are pretty good. I've also washed them every day as we have just started and has lots of accidents. They have held up amazingly well.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Crap!
customer_reviews.text: Crap! Way too big to potty train! My two yr old is only 10 pounds! So I can wear these not the baby!
customer_reviews.author: shawnda jarvis

customer_reviews.title: These are a nice pair of underwear for when your little one is ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice pair of underwear for when your little one is rarely having accidents and can stop when she feels she's peed before letting it all out. I'd say they run true to size. I ordered a 2T for my daughter after reading that some people thought they were big. They work just a little snug on the leg portion. She's 2 but in 3t clothing. I would get the same size as you get your child pants.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Derr

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with a little protection.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed to get my daughter to take potty training seriously. These protect against small accidents and give her time to get to the potty. Purchased a second pack bc she loves them so much. Very comfortable and fit well. My daughter is 28 lbs and in 2t/3t pants.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but smelly
customer_reviews.text: Given what these are about to be used for, it didn't phase me too much, but these smelled absolutely foul when they arrived. They smelled like maybe fish sauce and poo, I'm not sure exactly how to describe it. Whoever this seller is needs to check their stock.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training. Too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome for potty training. They O'Brien a good amount of pee but still let your kiddo know they're wet (as opposed to a diaper/pull-up). The only downfall is they're expensive. Why would underwear for a toddler be $3 a piece? You need like 16 pairs of undies in the beginning of potty training, so you're spending $50 on UNDIES!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

product_meta.title: Gerber Baby Girls 4-Pack Training Pant
product_meta.description: Get her ready to potty with this 4-pack of training pants! Made with a soft cotton, these training pants are comfortable and absorbent to help prevent leaks when accidents occur.
